mcqs.question: Which treaty established the European Union?

feedback.correct: The Treaty of Maastricht, signed in 1992, established the European Union.

incorrect.A: The Treaty of Lisbon, signed in 2007, amended the two treaties which form the constitutional basis of the EU but did not establish it.
incorrect.B: The Treaty of Rome established the European Economic Community (EEC), a precursor to the EU, but not the EU itself.
incorrect.D: The Treaty of Paris established the European Coal and Steel Community (ECSC), a precursor to the EU, but not the EU itself.

mcqs.question: Which city hosts the headquarters of the European Parliament?
mcqs.hint: This city is located in northeastern France.

feedback.correct: The European Parliament has its official seat in Strasbourg, France.

incorrect.A: Brussels hosts the European Commission and the Council of the European Union but not the official seat of the European Parliament.
incorrect.C: Luxembourg City hosts the European Court of Justice and other EU institutions but not the Parliament.
incorrect.D: Frankfurt hosts the European Central Bank but not the European Parliament.

mcqs.question: What is the common currency used by 19 of the 27 European Union member countries?

feedback.correct: The Euro is the common currency used by 19 of the 27 EU member countries.

incorrect.A: The Pound Sterling is the currency of the United Kingdom, which is no longer a member of the EU.
incorrect.B: The Danish Krone is the currency of Denmark, which has opted out of using the Euro.
incorrect.C: The Swiss Franc is the currency of Switzerland, which is not an EU member.

mcqs.question: Which of the following countries is not a member of the European Union?
mcqs.hint: This country is part of the European Economic Area but not the EU.

feedback.correct: Norway is not a member of the European Union but is part of the European Economic Area.

incorrect.B: Finland is a member of the European Union.
incorrect.C: Poland is a member of the European Union.
incorrect.D: Portugal is a member of the European Union.
